byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ashley Parker, Jeremy W. Peters, Alexander Burns, Thomas Kaplan and Matt Flegenheimer.
byline.original: By MAGGIE HABERMAN and ALAN RAPPEPORT

abstract: Top mainstream Republicans are feeling increased pressure to back candidacy of Sen Marco Rubio in aftermath of South Carolina primary, where Donald J Trump firmly outpaced his rivals; Trump has formidable delegate lead heading into caucuses in Nevada, where he is seen as favorite, and Trump is also seen as likely to do well in 11 states on Super Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: Senators Marco Rubio and Ted Cruz urged the rest of the party to coalesce around their campaigns as Mr. Trump gained even more momentum.

headline.main: After South Carolina, Cruz and Rubio Vie to Become Top Rival to Trump
headline.print_headline: New Jostling to Establish Trump Rival

snippet: Senators Marco Rubio and Ted Cruz urged the rest of the party to coalesce around their campaigns as Mr. Trump gained even more momentum.
